items.description: Scrase Bridge and West Common Streams

floodArea.riverOrSea: Scrase Bridge Stream, West Common Stream

items.message: High river levels on Friday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 29/08/2025 from 07:00 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast. Up to 40mm of rain could occur, but there is low confidence in location. If as much rain falls as predicted, then flooding could be possible. Flooding could affect a small number of properties on Bridge Road and West Common Road. Flooding could affect properties near the Witch Inn, along Hickmans Lane and Blackthorns, and odd numbered properties from 29 to 47 on Meadow Drive. River levels are likely to be higher than observed over the last 2 months. River levels should begin to fall by 12:00 29/08/2025. More rain is forecast on Monday (35mm), which could cause flood risk to return. We are clearing debris from weed screens through Lindfield, including the Builders Centre and Witch Inn. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Report blockages at Bridge Road or Hickmans Lane to 0800 80 70 60. This message will be updated by 29/08/2025 15:00.

items.description: River Pol and Langreek Stream at Polperro
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is expected during the early hours of Friday morning.
Heavy rain has fallen in the Polperro area causing the River Pol to rise rapidly.
Properties and low lying areas will start to flood first from around 00:30am on Friday.  River levels will be at their highest at this time and are expected to decrease during the early hours.
The main areas at risk include The Coombe, Lansallos Street, Mill Hill and Langreek Road.
Flood waters may be deep and fast flowing in these areas. Residents are strongly urged to take action now. Remain safe and be aware of your local surroundings.
We are closely monitoring the situation and this message will be updated as the situation changes. Our staff are out in the area clearing trash screens.

The water level in the Western Yar at Freshwater is high and rising rapidly.  In the last 3 hours, 35mm of rain has been recorded at Afton. This is a significant amount in a short period of time.  From 06:30 Friday 29/08/2025 surface water will flood School Green Road in Freshwater. The river will be bank full and may also come out of bank in some places, adding to the volume of water in the roads.  Heavy rain will continue to affect the area over the next 2 hours with up to 20mm possible. With continued rainfall if water levels continue to increase, in the next 1 hour we may issue a Flood Warning, for onset of property flooding from the river.  Our operational teams are out keeping streams clear of reported blockages. We continue to monitor the forecast.  If you live on School Green Road, please take appropriate action so that you can protect your property if required.  This Flood Alert will be updated at 12:00 Friday 29/08/25 or sooner, if we think property flooding will occur.
